parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A teacher and interpreter of the Mosaic Law. From nomos and didaskalos; an expounder of the law, i.e. A Rabbi.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From nous; to exercise the mind, i.e. to comprehend, heed.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To assert emphatically. Middle voice of a compound of dia and bebaioo; to confirm thoroughly, i.e. Asseverate.
